Event.0: American dramatist Edward Albee, an innovative writer of raw, stringent plays who was perhaps best known for Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? (1962), died at age 88.
Event.1: The Basque separatist organization ETA announced an indefinite cease-fire after 30 years of terrorist guerrilla attacks in Spain that were blamed for 800 deaths; the peace lasted 14 months.
Event.2: Apple Computer Inc names co-founder Steve Jobs interim CEO
Event.3: 14th Toronto International Film Festival: "Roger & Me" directed by Michael Moore wins the People's Choice Award
Event.4: Mohammad Zia-ul-Haq was proclaimed president of Pakistan.
Event.5: 25,000 die in 7.7 earthquake in Tabar, Iran
Event.6: American-born Greek operatic soprano Maria Callas died in Paris.
Event.7: Papua New Guinea achieved full independence from Australia.
Event.8: King Ḥussein of Jordan declared martial law following the hijacking of four international airliners by the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP).
Event.9: Comedic actor Bob Denver (32) weds second wife Jean Webber
Event.10: Metropolitan Opera House opens in Lincoln Center, New York with Leontyne Price as Cleopatra in "Antony and Cleopatra" by Samuel Barber
Event.11: Federation of Malaysia formed by Malaya, Singapore, British North Borneo (Sabah) and Sarawak
Event.12: LA City Council approves 300-acre site in Chavez Ravine for Dodgers
Event.13: Actor Henry Fonda (31) weds socialite Frances Ford Seymour (28) at Christ Church, New York City
Event.14:
Peter Falk
American actor
was born
Event.15:
B.B. King
American musician
was born
Event.16:
Lauren Bacall
American actress
was born
Event.17:
Lee Kuan Yew
prime minister of Singapore
was born
Event.18: The U.S. Congress granted a national charter to the American Legion, an organization of U.S. war veterans.
Event.19: Douglas Mawson, Edgeworth David and Alistair Mackay claim to have discovered the Magnetic South Pole in Antarctica
Event.20:
Karl Dönitz
German naval commander
was born
Event.21: Liliuokalani, Queen of Hawaii (1891-93) marries John Owen Dominis
Event.22: Slavery abolished in all French territories
Event.23: A local revolt in Mexico was sparked by Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, a parish priest in Dolores, who uttered the Grito de Dolores (“Cry of Dolores”), calling for the end of rule by Spanish peninsulars, for equality of races, and for redistribution of land.
Event.24: Mexico issues Grito de Dolores, calling for the end of Spanish rule (Mexican Independence Day)
Event.25: British capture Capetown, South Africa, from the Dutch
Event.26:
Mayflower's departure for America
On this date in 1620, English colonists aboard the Mayflower set sail for America, where they founded Plymouth, Massachusetts, after 41 men, including William Bradford and Myles Standish, signed the Mayflower Compact.
Event.27: Charles V, who was king of France from 1364 and led the country in a miraculous recovery from the devastation of the first phase of the Hundred Years' War (1337–1453), died.
